divs: Sighting DetailsSighting Report: I was in the US Air Force, stationed at Shreveport La. in the early 1950"s. I was a gunnery Sgt, on a B-29. We flew many training missions up and down the East Coast, on several occasions, something would follow our course, it appeared to be a big light glow. but it seemed to have control. We, the crew members would follow and discuss the appearences, I asked our Pilot on one occasion, a Major, if he would make a report, his response, "if I made a report I would not get another promotion" He was a carrier Officer. I was living off base, we had an early morning training mission, had to be at the base at 6:30 AM., as I left the house I saw a flying object that was not one of ours. I looked up and saw this Flying object, coming toward my direction, it was at about 1000 feet altitude, completely silent, cigar shaped, about as long as a foot ball field, port holes every 10 or 15 feet, it came in slow and silent, when it was almosst overhead, it turned, pointed it s nose slightly up and flew off in the direction of the air base and vanished. I got into my car, went to the base, and checked with the guard at the expermintal hanger. Told him I wanted to have a look inside, I reached for the door handle, and he said, "Sarge. if you open that door,I will blow the s--it out of you" he was serious, I then told him I saw something in the air and said I wanted to know if we had anything like that in our hanger" his eyes got as big as silver dollars and he said he saw it also. I asked him to describe what he had seen, he described the exact same object that I had seen.
